data:
1
00:01:47,527 --> 00:01:49,279
Bingo!

2
00:02:03,007 --> 00:02:04,804
Fucking hell.

3
00:02:06,967 --> 00:02:08,844
Fucking hell.

4
00:02:56,927 --> 00:02:59,487
- Oh, God...
- Keep your shit together.

5
00:02:59,567 --> 00:03:02,525
If you wanna get 'em out of here.

6
00:03:03,327 --> 00:03:05,887
- I can pop these, no problem.
- So get to it!

7
00:03:19,527 --> 00:03:21,916
Security, we have a break-in. Get the...

8
00:03:30,047 --> 00:03:32,766
I know who you are.
I know what you think...

9
00:03:32,847 --> 00:03:36,522
If you don't wanna get hurt,
keep your mouth shut and don't move.

10
00:03:36,607 --> 00:03:41,635
The chimps are infected. They're highly
contagious. They've been given an inhibitor.

11
00:03:41,727 --> 00:03:45,037
- Infected with what?
- To cure, you must first understand.

12
00:03:45,127 --> 00:03:47,960
Infected with what?

13
00:03:49,847 --> 00:03:51,644
Rage.

14
00:03:53,287 --> 00:03:56,324
- What is he talking about?
- Get the cages open.

15
00:03:56,407 --> 00:03:57,681
No! No! No!

16
00:03:58,367 --> 00:04:02,485
Listen, you sick bastard,
we're taking your torture victims with us.

17
00:04:02,567 --> 00:04:04,080
We'll get you out of here.

18
00:04:04,167 --> 00:04:08,638
The animals are contagious. The infection
is in their blood and saliva. One bite...

19
00:04:08,727 --> 00:04:11,116
Stop... Stop! You've no idea!

20
00:04:17,407 --> 00:04:20,126
Get it off! Help me!

21
00:04:25,287 --> 00:04:27,323
Get it off! Get it off!

22
00:04:30,807 --> 00:04:33,879
- What's the matter with her?
- You have to kill her!

23
00:04:35,887 --> 00:04:38,037
Oh, my God!

24
00:04:42,207 --> 00:04:45,279
- What's the matter with her?
- We have to kill her now!

25
00:04:47,687 --> 00:04:49,200
Oh, God...

26
00:06:33,727 --> 00:06:35,160
Hello?

27
00:07:12,047 --> 00:07:13,480
Hello?

28
00:07:30,887 --> 00:07:32,798
Hello!

29
00:09:10,567 --> 00:09:11,841
Hello?

30
00:09:37,087 --> 00:09:38,520
Hello!

31
00:14:18,887 --> 00:14:20,878
Hello?

32
00:14:28,567 --> 00:14:30,558
Hello?

33
00:14:44,327 --> 00:14:46,318
Father?

34
00:14:52,487 --> 00:14:54,478
Father, are you OK?

35
00:15:01,527 --> 00:15:04,087
Oh, shouldn't have done that.

36
00:15:04,487 --> 00:15:06,637
Shouldn't have done that.

37
00:15:07,047 --> 00:15:08,844
Shit!

38
00:15:34,527 --> 00:15:36,563
Over here!

39
00:15:39,327 --> 00:15:41,557
- Over here!
- Come on!

40
00:15:53,527 --> 00:15:55,882
Go, go, go!

41
00:16:00,927 --> 00:16:01,962
Keep going!

42
00:16:02,047 --> 00:16:04,800
- What the fuck is going on?
- Just shut up!

43
00:16:12,607 --> 00:16:15,075
- Covered everything.
- Who are those people?

44
00:16:41,287 --> 00:16:42,481
Let's go! Let's go!

45
00:16:42,567 --> 00:16:44,717
- What the fuck is going on?
- Just move!

46
00:16:53,167 --> 00:16:55,078
Come on!

47
00:17:13,487 --> 00:17:18,038
Man walks into a bar with a giraffe.
They each get pissed.

48
00:17:18,127 --> 00:17:20,038
The giraffe falls over.

49
00:17:20,127 --> 00:17:25,121
The man goes to leave and the barman says
"Oi! You can't leave that lying there."

50
00:17:25,207 --> 00:17:29,086
He says "No, it's not a lion. It's a giraffe".

51
00:17:36,407 --> 00:17:39,160
He's completely humourless.

52
00:17:39,247 --> 00:17:42,045
You two should get on like a house on fire.

53
00:17:43,487 --> 00:17:45,478
So who are you?

54
00:17:46,647 --> 00:17:48,478
You're from the hospital.

55
00:17:48,567 --> 00:17:51,923
- Are you a doctor?
- He's not a doctor. He's a patient.

56
00:17:52,007 --> 00:17:54,237
I'm a bicycle courier.

57
00:17:56,327 --> 00:18:02,482
I was riding a package from Farringdon to
Shaftesbury Avenue and a car cut across me.

58
00:18:02,567 --> 00:18:06,162
Then I wake up today in hospital.
I wake up and I'm...

59
00:18:06,247 --> 00:18:08,078
I'm hallucinating or I'm...

60
00:18:09,687 --> 00:18:12,042
What's your name?

61
00:18:12,127 --> 00:18:14,118
Jim.

62
00:18:14,767 --> 00:18:17,327
I'm Mark. This is Selena.

63
00:18:21,567 --> 00:18:23,159
OK, Jim.

64
00:18:28,167 --> 00:18:30,601
I've got some bad news.

65
00:18:30,687 --> 00:18:36,683
It started as rioting, and right from
the beginning you knew this was different.

66
00:18:36,767 --> 00:18:40,760
Because it was happening
in small villages, market towns.

67
00:18:41,607 --> 00:18:44,246
And then it wasn't on the TV any more.

68
00:18:44,327 --> 00:18:48,843
It was in the street outside.
It was coming through your windows.

69
00:18:48,927 --> 00:18:50,679
It was a virus.

70
00:18:50,767 --> 00:18:52,485
An infection.

71
00:18:52,567 --> 00:18:55,286
You didn't need a doctor to tell you that.

72
00:18:55,367 --> 00:18:57,722
It was the blood.

73
00:18:57,807 --> 00:19:00,196
There was something in the blood.

74
00:19:01,607 --> 00:19:06,362
By the time they tried to evacuate
the cities, it was already too late.

75
00:19:06,447 --> 00:19:09,245
The infection was everywhere.

76
00:19:09,327 --> 00:19:11,716
The army blockades were overrun.

77
00:19:13,207 --> 00:19:15,801
And that's when the exodus started.

78
00:19:17,127 --> 00:19:19,766
The day before broadcasting stopped,

79
00:19:19,847 --> 00:19:23,362
there were reports of Infection
in Paris and New York.

80
00:19:25,647 --> 00:19:28,445
We didn't hear anything more after that.

81
00:19:31,287 --> 00:19:34,120
- What's the government doing?
- There's no government.

82
00:19:34,207 --> 00:19:36,562
Of course there's a government!

83
00:19:36,647 --> 00:19:40,560
There's always a government.
They're in a bunker or a plane...

84
00:19:40,647 --> 00:19:44,765
No, there's no government,
no police, no army.

85
00:19:46,167 --> 00:19:49,125
No TV, no radio, no electricity.

86
00:19:49,727 --> 00:19:53,720
You're the first uninfected person
we've seen in six days.

87
00:19:54,527 --> 00:19:56,518
Where's your family?

88
00:19:57,407 --> 00:19:59,363
They're dead. Like Selena's.

89
00:19:59,447 --> 00:20:01,483
Yours will be dead too.

90
00:20:11,367 --> 00:20:15,201
Look, I have to find them.
They live in Deptford. I can walk it. OK?

91
00:20:15,287 --> 00:20:17,755
You'll go and come back, yeah?

92
00:20:19,647 --> 00:20:21,797
- You won't.
- Yes!

93
00:20:21,887 --> 00:20:24,765
No one ever comes back.

94
00:20:29,087 --> 00:20:31,078
So lesson one.

95
00:20:31,927 --> 00:20:36,159
You never go anywhere alone
unless you've got no choice.

96
00:20:36,247 --> 00:20:38,477
Lesson two.

97
00:20:38,567 --> 00:20:42,480
Only travel during daylight.
Unless you've got no choice.

98
00:20:44,447 --> 00:20:46,403
We'll take you tomorrow.

99
00:20:46,487 --> 00:20:49,923
We'll all go and find
your dead parents together, OK?

100
00:20:50,927 --> 00:20:52,326
Eat.

101
00:21:04,007 --> 00:21:07,044
If you want her to slow down,
you'll have to say.

102
00:21:32,847 --> 00:21:34,439
- If there's anyone...
- I understand.

103
00:21:34,527 --> 00:21:36,518
- Anyone...
- I understand!

104
00:21:38,567 --> 00:21:40,046
OK.

105
00:22:20,127 --> 00:22:21,401
Jim...

106
00:22:22,207 --> 00:22:23,481
Wait!

107
00:23:44,687 --> 00:23:48,475
They died peacefully.
You should be grateful.

108
00:23:48,567 --> 00:23:50,876
I'm not grateful.

109
00:23:52,087 --> 00:23:53,998
My...

110
00:23:54,687 --> 00:23:58,999
parents and my sister,
we went to Paddington Station,

111
00:24:01,527 --> 00:24:06,647
hoping maybe we could get on a plane,
maybe we could buy our way onto a plane.

112
00:24:07,247 --> 00:24:09,522
I remember my dad had all this cash,

113
00:24:09,607 --> 00:24:12,804
even though cash was completely useless.

114
00:24:14,287 --> 00:24:17,279
About 20,000 other people had the same idea.

115
00:24:19,687 --> 00:24:21,803
Crowd was surging.

116
00:24:22,607 --> 00:24:24,837
I lost my grip on my sister's hand.

117
00:24:26,927 --> 00:24:29,157
I remember the ground was soft.

118
00:24:31,047 --> 00:24:35,245
I looked down
and I was standing on all these people.

119
00:24:35,327 --> 00:24:39,115
Like a carpet. People who had fallen and...

120
00:24:39,207 --> 00:24:42,995
Somewhere in the crowd
there were Infected. It spread fast.

121
00:24:43,087 --> 00:24:46,284
No one could run.
All you could do was climb.

122
00:24:47,847 --> 00:24:50,805
Climb over more people.
So I did that. I climbed.

123
00:24:50,887 --> 00:24:53,162
And I got up on top of this kiosk.

124
00:24:55,367 --> 00:25:00,122
Looking down, you couldn't tell
which faces were infected and which weren't.

125
00:25:00,207 --> 00:25:03,916
Then I saw my dad.
Not my mum or my sister.

126
00:25:04,007 --> 00:25:05,884
My dad.

127
00:25:08,087 --> 00:25:10,078
His face...

128
00:25:13,607 --> 00:25:17,361
Selena's right.
You should be grateful.

129
00:25:17,447 --> 00:25:22,396
We don't have time to get back to the shop
before dark. We should stay here tonight.

130
00:25:24,967 --> 00:25:27,686
My room's up at the top.
You two can have that.

131
00:25:27,767 --> 00:25:30,964
No, we'll all sleep in the same room. It's safer.

132
00:26:47,967 --> 00:26:49,958
Jim.

133
00:26:58,287 --> 00:27:00,278
- You're back.
- Yeah.

134
00:27:06,407 --> 00:27:08,398
- How was it?
- Fine.

135
00:27:09,447 --> 00:27:11,642
Give me a drink of that, will ya?

136
00:27:11,727 --> 00:27:13,718
- It's empty.
- Ha!

137
00:27:15,927 --> 00:27:18,157
Here.

138
00:27:20,167 --> 00:27:22,158
I'll start working on them, then.

139
00:27:28,527 --> 00:27:30,438
Mark! Mark!

140
00:27:31,207 --> 00:27:33,243
Selena! Help!

141
00:27:47,007 --> 00:27:48,998
It's clear.

142
00:27:54,247 --> 00:27:57,080
- That's Mr Bridges.
- Were you bitten?

143
00:27:57,167 --> 00:27:59,283
And his daughter. From four doors down.

144
00:27:59,367 --> 00:28:02,325
- Were you bitten?
- No.

145
00:28:02,407 --> 00:28:05,205
Did any of the blood get in your mouth?

146
00:28:06,087 --> 00:28:07,998
No.

147
00:28:11,007 --> 00:28:12,679
Mark?

148
00:28:15,007 --> 00:28:16,645
Wait...

149
00:28:37,607 --> 00:28:39,723
Get that cleaned off.

150
00:28:41,527 --> 00:28:43,518
Do you have any clothes here?

151
00:28:44,607 --> 00:28:46,404
Um... I... Yes.

152
00:28:46,487 --> 00:28:50,002
Then get them and get dressed.
We have to leave now.

153
00:28:50,087 --> 00:28:53,602
More Infected will be coming.
They always do.

154
00:29:21,207 --> 00:29:24,085
How did you know?
How did you know he was infected?

155
00:29:24,167 --> 00:29:27,921
- The blood.
- There was blood on me. It was on you.

156
00:29:28,007 --> 00:29:33,161
I didn't know he was infected.
He knew. I could see it in his face.

157
00:29:33,247 --> 00:29:37,479
If someone gets infected,
you've about 20 seconds to kill them.

158
00:29:37,567 --> 00:29:42,482
It might be your brother, your sister
or your oldest friend. It makes no difference.

159
00:29:42,567 --> 00:29:47,766
Just so you know where you stand,
if it happens to you, I'll do it in a heartbeat.

160
00:29:47,847 --> 00:29:51,886
He was full of plans.
Have you got any plans, Jim?

161
00:29:51,967 --> 00:29:56,245
Do you want us to find a cure and
save the world or just fall in love and fuck?

162
00:29:56,327 --> 00:29:58,716
Plans are pointless.

163
00:29:58,807 --> 00:30:01,275
Staying alive's as good as it gets.

164
00:30:03,047 --> 00:30:04,400
Hey, hey, hey, hey.

165
00:30:04,487 --> 00:30:06,478
What's that?

166
00:30:12,327 --> 00:30:14,318
Let's go.

167
00:30:57,607 --> 00:31:00,599
What is it about tower blocks
and shopping trolleys?

168
00:31:00,687 --> 00:31:03,645
Stop talking. It's a long way up.

169
00:31:12,967 --> 00:31:15,197
Do you need a break?

170
00:31:16,367 --> 00:31:18,278
- You?
- No.

171
00:31:20,847 --> 00:31:22,838
Now I do need a break.

172
00:31:32,887 --> 00:31:34,639
What's up?

173
00:31:34,727 --> 00:31:36,638
Nothin'.

174
00:31:38,927 --> 00:31:40,201
I got a headache.

175
00:31:40,287 --> 00:31:41,720
- Bad?
- Pretty bad.

176
00:31:41,807 --> 00:31:46,881
- Why didn't you say something before?
- I didn't think you'd give a shit.

177
00:31:48,047 --> 00:31:52,120
You've got no fat on you
and all you've had to eat is sugar.

178
00:31:52,207 --> 00:31:54,243
So you're crashing.

179
00:31:54,327 --> 00:31:56,477
There isn't a lot we can do about that

180
00:31:56,567 --> 00:32:01,436
except pump you full of painkillers
and give you more sugar. As for sugar,

181
00:32:01,527 --> 00:32:03,722
Pepsi or Lilt?

182
00:32:04,927 --> 00:32:06,838
Do you have any Tango?

183
00:32:06,927 --> 00:32:09,839
Actually,
I did have a can of Tango somewhere.

184
00:32:11,007 --> 00:32:13,157
Quiet! That's an Infected.

185
00:32:23,087 --> 00:32:24,839
Oh no, they're in. Move!

186
00:32:27,807 --> 00:32:30,241
Wait up, Selena!

187
00:32:31,127 --> 00:32:33,038
Wait for me, please!

188
00:32:33,127 --> 00:32:35,163
Please, Selena! Please!

189
00:32:35,247 --> 00:32:37,477
- Wait for me!
- Come on!

190
00:32:37,567 --> 00:32:39,478
- Run!
- Wait!

191
00:32:40,087 --> 00:32:42,681
Please! For fuck's sake!

192
00:32:43,247 --> 00:32:45,397
- Selena!

193
00:32:47,047 --> 00:32:50,278
Down the corridor. Flat 157. Move!

194
00:32:50,367 --> 00:32:52,358
Thank you. Thank you.

195
00:33:04,327 --> 00:33:06,283
Open the door!

196
00:33:11,647 --> 00:33:13,160
Open the door!

197
00:33:17,687 --> 00:33:20,076
- Open up!
- Where's Dad?

198
00:33:20,167 --> 00:33:21,566
What?

199
00:33:24,047 --> 00:33:26,925
- Open the fucking door!
- Where's Dad?

200
00:33:27,007 --> 00:33:29,202
Let them in, Hannah. Let them inside.

201
00:33:36,807 --> 00:33:39,002
Go in. Go in!

202
00:33:56,287 --> 00:33:58,642
So, I'm Frank, anyway.

203
00:33:58,727 --> 00:34:00,445
Jim.

204
00:34:01,247 --> 00:34:04,205
- Selena.
- Selena. Good to meet you.

205
00:34:04,287 --> 00:34:06,482
This is my daughter Hannah.

206
00:34:06,567 --> 00:34:08,717
Come on, sweetheart. Say hello.

207
00:34:10,087 --> 00:34:12,078
Come on.

208
00:34:12,807 --> 00:34:14,684
So...

209
00:34:14,767 --> 00:34:16,598
This is great. Just great.

210
00:34:18,847 --> 00:34:21,042
Calls for a celebration, I'd say.

211
00:34:21,127 --> 00:34:24,039
Why don't you all sit down and...

212
00:34:24,127 --> 00:34:26,960
Hannah, what have we got to offer?

213
00:34:27,047 --> 00:34:29,436
We've got Mum's creme de menthe.

214
00:34:29,527 --> 00:34:32,121
Great. Creme de menthe.

215
00:34:32,207 --> 00:34:34,801
Oh, yeah. Look, sit, please.

216
00:34:34,887 --> 00:34:37,242
Get comfortable.

217
00:34:39,967 --> 00:34:42,845
- Where are the bloody glasses?
- Middle cupboard.

218
00:34:42,927 --> 00:34:45,680
Nah, the good ones. It's a celebration.

219
00:34:45,767 --> 00:34:48,156
Top cupboard.

220
00:34:48,247 --> 00:34:50,841
So this is your place?

221
00:34:52,047 --> 00:34:53,719
It's nice.

222
00:35:06,367 --> 00:35:07,436
There.

223
00:35:07,527 --> 00:35:10,485
I know it isn't much but, well, cheers.

224
00:35:10,567 --> 00:35:12,239
Cheers.

225
00:35:32,887 --> 00:35:34,878
You OK in there, Jim?

226
00:35:35,807 --> 00:35:38,037
Yeah.

227
00:35:38,127 --> 00:35:43,485
Sorry we couldn't spare the water.
Same with the toilet. The flush doesn't work.

228
00:35:45,087 --> 00:35:47,237
You'll have to use the bucket.

229
00:35:53,527 --> 00:35:56,041
Have to empty it each morning.

230
00:35:56,127 --> 00:35:59,642
Just chuck it over the balcony.
No mod cons here.

231
00:35:59,727 --> 00:36:01,365
It's fine.

232
00:36:01,447 --> 00:36:04,439
Listen, it's late. We're gonna turn in.

233
00:36:06,047 --> 00:36:08,322
We have a spare room.

234
00:36:09,327 --> 00:36:10,555
In there.

235
00:36:10,647 --> 00:36:12,524
Are you and Selena...?

236
00:36:13,727 --> 00:36:15,479
No. No, no, no.

237
00:36:15,567 --> 00:36:17,159
Um...

238
00:36:17,247 --> 00:36:19,522
I'll take the living room. It's fine.

239
00:36:19,607 --> 00:36:21,404
Right.

240
00:36:22,247 --> 00:36:24,238
No, I mean, yeah.

241
00:36:25,247 --> 00:36:27,158
So, um...

242
00:36:28,167 --> 00:36:31,045
- Goodnight, then.
- Yeah. Goodnight, Frank.

243
00:36:45,087 --> 00:36:46,566
Very spruce.

244
00:36:47,847 --> 00:36:50,566
- Very shredded.
- Yeah.

245
00:36:54,727 --> 00:36:58,276
- So what do you make of them?
- Well, they're desperate.

246
00:36:59,367 --> 00:37:02,086
Probably need us more than we need them.

247
00:37:03,487 --> 00:37:05,637
I think they're good people.

248
00:37:08,367 --> 00:37:11,200
- Good people?
- Yeah.

249
00:37:12,927 --> 00:37:17,398
You should be more concerned about
whether they're gonna slow you down.

250
00:37:17,487 --> 00:37:21,082
- Because if they slowed you down...
- I'd leave them behind.

251
00:37:21,167 --> 00:37:22,998
- In a heartbeat.
- Yeah.

252
00:37:23,687 --> 00:37:25,279
I wouldn't.

253
00:37:25,367 --> 00:37:28,757
Then you're gonna wind up
getting yourself killed.

254
00:37:36,767 --> 00:37:39,156
I'm gonna get some sleep.

255
00:37:41,567 --> 00:37:43,364
Selena...

256
00:37:44,167 --> 00:37:47,284
You think I don't get it, but I do get it.

257
00:37:49,087 --> 00:37:52,921
And I know I'd be dead already
if I hadn't met you.

258
00:37:53,407 --> 00:37:54,920
Sure.

259
00:37:55,007 --> 00:37:56,520
No, look...

260
00:37:58,807 --> 00:38:00,798
I mean, thank you.

261
00:38:03,847 --> 00:38:05,917
And I mean, sure.

262
00:38:06,007 --> 00:38:08,680
Goodnight, Jim.

263
00:38:08,767 --> 00:38:10,758
Goodnight.

264
00:38:23,807 --> 00:38:25,798
We lost water pressure three weeks ago.

265
00:38:25,887 --> 00:38:29,846
I thought we'd be OK with the water
from the other flats. Cisterns and tanks.

266
00:38:29,927 --> 00:38:32,999
But it vanishes so quick
you wouldn't believe.

267
00:38:36,167 --> 00:38:37,805
You drink it,

268
00:38:37,887 --> 00:38:39,605
it evaporates,

269
00:38:39,687 --> 00:38:41,678
turns stagnant.

270
00:38:43,967 --> 00:38:45,958
They're all empty.

271
00:38:46,807 --> 00:38:48,718
Hasn't rained in ten days.

272
00:38:48,807 --> 00:38:52,880
You can set up a plastic sheet
to catch dew and condensation.

273
00:38:52,967 --> 00:38:56,562
Saw it on TV once, but I can't make it work.

274
00:38:57,847 --> 00:38:59,838
You'd never think it.

275
00:39:00,727 --> 00:39:03,560
Needing rain so badly.

276
00:39:05,167 --> 00:39:07,476
Not in fucking England!

277
00:39:11,967 --> 00:39:14,959
Jim, we're not going to be able to stay here.

278
00:39:23,527 --> 00:39:27,122
- There's been no broadcasts for weeks.
- Just listen.

279
00:39:27,207 --> 00:39:31,598
Salvation is here.
The answer to Infection is here.

280
00:39:31,687 --> 00:39:34,565
if you can hear this, you're not alone.

281
00:39:34,647 --> 00:39:38,959
There are others like you.
There are other survivors.

282
00:39:39,047 --> 00:39:41,163
We are soldiers and we are armed.

283
00:39:41,247 --> 00:39:44,398
Oh, my God. Soldiers.

284
00:39:44,487 --> 00:39:48,878
- Quiet. There's more.
- Our location is the 42nd blockade, M602,

285
00:39:48,967 --> 00:39:52,243
27 miles northeast of Manchester.

286
00:39:52,327 --> 00:39:56,081
- You must find us. Salvation is...
- Now it just repeats.

287
00:39:56,167 --> 00:39:58,442
- It's a recording?
- Yeah, it's a recording.

288
00:39:58,527 --> 00:40:01,325
But this is where it's telling us to go.

289
00:40:01,407 --> 00:40:03,477
Just there.

290
00:40:04,927 --> 00:40:09,523
The way things are, we might need
two or three days to get up there.

291
00:40:09,607 --> 00:40:11,245
"We"?

292
00:40:15,167 --> 00:40:21,003
Sound carries in this flat. Me and Hannah
do need you more than you need us.

293
00:40:21,087 --> 00:40:24,124
- Look, I didn't...
- No, it's OK. It's the truth.

294
00:40:24,207 --> 00:40:26,596
I can't leave the block if it's the two of us.

295
00:40:26,687 --> 00:40:30,475
Something might happen to me.
Hannah'd be alone. I couldn't risk it.

296
00:40:30,567 --> 00:40:32,205
But with other people...

297
00:40:32,287 --> 00:40:36,405
If it's a recording,
the soldiers who made it could be dead.

298
00:40:36,487 --> 00:40:39,843
- It's possible.
- That stuff about the answer to Infection...

299
00:40:39,927 --> 00:40:44,045
There is no answer!
It's already done all the damage it can!

300
00:40:44,127 --> 00:40:46,846
- Maybe they have a cure.
- Maybe they've got nothing.

301
00:40:46,927 --> 00:40:50,840
- The only way to find out is to reach them.
- We could die trying, Frank!

302
00:40:52,847 --> 00:40:55,042
Or die here.

303
00:40:55,127 --> 00:41:00,599
And anyway, it isn't true what Dad said.
You need us just the same as we need you.

304
00:41:02,047 --> 00:41:03,844
We need each other.

305
00:41:03,927 --> 00:41:09,001
And we'll never be safe in the cities.
The soldiers could keep us safe.

306
00:41:09,687 --> 00:41:11,678
So we have to try and get there.

307
00:41:12,767 --> 00:41:14,280
Get there how?

308
00:41:25,247 --> 00:41:28,842
Just so you know,
I don't take cheques or credit cards.

309
00:41:56,247 --> 00:41:59,125
- What do you think?
- It's the most direct route.

310
00:41:59,207 --> 00:42:04,235
Then we should take the indirect route.
The one in daylight and not underground.

311
00:42:04,327 --> 00:42:06,557
Let's just get it done.

312
00:42:18,967 --> 00:42:21,037
No, no.

313
00:42:21,127 --> 00:42:23,516
No. See, this is a really shit idea.

314
00:42:24,367 --> 00:42:27,598
You know why?
Because it's obviously a shit idea.

315
00:42:27,687 --> 00:42:31,885
So we're gonna drive into the tunnel
full of fucking smashed cars...

316
00:42:31,967 --> 00:42:34,765
It's really fucking obviously a shit idea!

317
00:42:34,847 --> 00:42:36,997
Hold on!

318
00:42:45,807 --> 00:42:47,604
Dad!

319
00:43:06,247 --> 00:43:07,726
Fuck!

320
00:43:08,967 --> 00:43:11,276
The world's worst place to get a flat.

321
00:43:11,367 --> 00:43:14,564
Agreed. I think we'd better do this quick.

322
00:43:16,967 --> 00:43:19,037
I've got the wheel. You're on the jack.

323
00:43:33,047 --> 00:43:36,437
Do you hear that?
Hey, hey, do you hear that?

324
00:43:36,527 --> 00:43:38,518
Hear what?

325
00:43:39,167 --> 00:43:41,362
Right, I've done it.

326
00:43:42,887 --> 00:43:44,286
Dad?

327
00:43:48,007 --> 00:43:50,965
- Jesus Christ!

328
00:43:51,047 --> 00:43:52,526
Fucking rats!

329
00:44:02,647 --> 00:44:05,115
They're running from the Infected.

330
00:44:05,207 --> 00:44:07,038
Move it!

331
00:44:07,127 --> 00:44:11,245
Forget the jack, Hannah.
There's no time. Just lift, everyone.

332
00:44:11,327 --> 00:44:14,444
Grab hold! One, two, three, lift!

333
00:44:18,247 --> 00:44:20,124
Lift, lift!

334
00:44:20,647 --> 00:44:25,562
- Don't look at them! Don't look!
- I can see them! They're coming!

335
00:44:31,047 --> 00:44:33,515
Come on, Hannah!

336
00:44:33,607 --> 00:44:35,916
Almost.

337
00:44:36,007 --> 00:44:38,805
- Get the tyre on, Hannah!
- I'm trying.

338
00:44:43,407 --> 00:44:45,967
Three, two, one,

339
00:44:46,047 --> 00:44:47,685
drop it!

340
00:44:51,647 --> 00:44:54,002
- Get in the car!
- Come on!

341
00:44:56,007 --> 00:44:58,282
- Frank, drive!
- Move it, Frank!

342
00:45:01,087 --> 00:45:03,078
Whoo!

343
00:45:07,687 --> 00:45:09,678
Goodbye, you fuckers!

344
00:45:17,327 --> 00:45:19,522
Frank, stop the cab.

345
00:45:41,567 --> 00:45:43,762
Let's shop.

346
00:45:53,967 --> 00:45:55,400
You...

347
00:45:56,167 --> 00:45:57,600
You...

348
00:45:58,407 --> 00:45:59,442
You...

349
00:45:59,527 --> 00:46:01,995
Anybody seen any buns?

350
00:46:02,087 --> 00:46:04,760
Hmm. Irradiated.

351
00:46:07,367 --> 00:46:10,803
Don't take anything
that needs to be cooked, OK?

352
00:46:10,887 --> 00:46:12,639
I think you can eat that raw.

353
00:46:12,727 --> 00:46:14,524
Decaffeinated coffee...

354
00:46:14,607 --> 00:46:16,598
Put that back.

355
00:46:17,767 --> 00:46:19,917
CanÂ’t just take any crap.

356
00:46:20,007 --> 00:46:24,319
If I never see another chocolate bar again,
it'll be too soon.

357
00:46:24,727 --> 00:46:27,287
Not counting Terry's Chocolate Orange!

358
00:46:28,847 --> 00:46:32,317
Now, single malt,
16-year-old, dark, full flavour.

359
00:46:33,247 --> 00:46:35,124
Warm but not aggressive.

360
00:46:35,207 --> 00:46:38,563
- Peaty aftertaste.

361
00:46:40,087 --> 00:46:43,204
Takes out the fire but leaves in the warmth.

362
00:47:35,847 --> 00:47:38,805
Either we do this now or we're walking.

363
00:47:45,527 --> 00:47:47,518
Not you.

364
00:47:50,727 --> 00:47:52,922
- Stay close, Jim.
- What?

365
00:47:53,007 --> 00:47:54,998
You heard.

366
00:48:20,487 --> 00:48:22,478
Where are you going?

367
00:48:23,527 --> 00:48:25,836
We've got enough food, Jim.

368
00:48:25,927 --> 00:48:28,157
We don't have any cheeseburgers.

369
00:48:28,887 --> 00:48:31,447
Like going on holidays
with your aunt!

370
00:49:09,047 --> 00:49:11,402
Oh, Jesus.

371
00:49:36,167 --> 00:49:37,646
Hello?

372
00:49:50,887 --> 00:49:52,605
I hate you!

373
00:50:01,407 --> 00:50:03,398
Find anything?

374
00:50:05,567 --> 00:50:08,240
- Find anything, Jim?
- No! Let's get outta here.

375
00:50:08,327 --> 00:50:10,318
OK, we're done here.

376
00:50:12,447 --> 00:50:14,244
OK, Hannah.

377
00:50:21,327 --> 00:50:22,919
Easy. Brake!

378
00:50:23,007 --> 00:50:24,998
Brake, brake!

379
00:50:32,527 --> 00:50:34,518
Out.

380
00:51:17,287 --> 00:51:20,359
Mmmm! Oh my God!

381
00:51:21,087 --> 00:51:23,965
I can, like, taste the vitamin C.

382
00:51:24,767 --> 00:51:27,440
Mmmm, the raisins are so moist.

383
00:51:28,607 --> 00:51:30,598
What did you say?

384
00:51:30,687 --> 00:51:33,360
The raisins. They're so moist.

385
00:51:37,927 --> 00:51:39,918
Look over here.

386
00:51:50,767 --> 00:51:52,519
Like a family.

387
00:51:52,607 --> 00:51:54,962
Do you think they're infected?

388
00:51:55,367 --> 00:51:57,358
No.

389
00:52:00,687 --> 00:52:03,281
They're doing just fine.

390
00:52:08,807 --> 00:52:10,798
Come on. Let's eat!

391
00:52:24,887 --> 00:52:26,161
Know what I was thinking?

392
00:52:26,247 --> 00:52:29,796
That you'll never hear
another piece of original music again.

393
00:52:29,887 --> 00:52:33,880
You'll never read a book
that hasn't already been written,

394
00:52:34,887 --> 00:52:38,562
or see a film that hasn't already been shot.

395
00:52:42,887 --> 00:52:46,004
Um... that's what you were thinking.

396
00:52:46,087 --> 00:52:47,884
No.

397
00:52:49,087 --> 00:52:51,282
I was thinking I was wrong.

398
00:52:52,487 --> 00:52:54,478
About what?

399
00:52:56,127 --> 00:52:58,118
All the death.

400
00:52:58,687 --> 00:53:00,678
All this shit.

401
00:53:02,247 --> 00:53:06,559
It doesn't really mean anything
to Frank and Hannah because...

402
00:53:07,887 --> 00:53:11,197
Well, she's got her dad
and he's got his daughter. So...

403
00:53:11,287 --> 00:53:13,323
Cheeky monkey!

404
00:53:13,767 --> 00:53:17,237
I was wrong when I said
staying alive is as good as it gets.

405
00:53:20,727 --> 00:53:23,116
See, that's what I was thinking.

406
00:53:23,607 --> 00:53:25,199
Was it?

407
00:53:25,287 --> 00:53:27,482
Mm. You stole my thought.

408
00:53:32,487 --> 00:53:34,284
Sorry.

409
00:53:35,207 --> 00:53:37,004
That's OK.

410
00:53:37,087 --> 00:53:39,078
You can keep it.

411
00:53:40,167 --> 00:53:44,001
It's getting late.
We'd better stay here for the night.

412
00:53:58,447 --> 00:54:00,881
I can't sleep.

413
00:54:00,967 --> 00:54:03,481
Me neither.

414
00:54:03,567 --> 00:54:05,842
Doesn't feel safe, does it?

415
00:54:05,927 --> 00:54:07,918
Outside like this.

416
00:54:08,767 --> 00:54:11,076
I think we're safe enough.

417
00:54:11,167 --> 00:54:13,727
Selena didn't seem to have any trouble.

418
00:54:14,407 --> 00:54:16,796
Yeah, I noticed that.

419
00:54:16,887 --> 00:54:18,320
Hey, Selena...

420
00:54:18,407 --> 00:54:20,398
What? What is it?

421
00:54:21,687 --> 00:54:23,643
How'd you get to sleep?

422
00:54:29,847 --> 00:54:33,556
Bloody hell. Must've needed
a hell of a prescription for that lot.

423
00:54:33,647 --> 00:54:37,765
I didn't need a prescription.
I qualified as a chemist.

424
00:54:37,847 --> 00:54:40,281
Oh, great. Valium.

425
00:54:40,367 --> 00:54:42,835
Not only will we be able to get to sleep

426
00:54:42,927 --> 00:54:46,476
but if we're attacked in the middle
of the night, we won't even care.

427
00:54:46,567 --> 00:54:48,717
- Two each.
- Not for me, thanks.

428
00:54:48,807 --> 00:54:50,763
Can I, Dad?

429
00:54:50,847 --> 00:54:52,758
I don't think so, sweetheart.

430
00:54:52,847 --> 00:54:54,280
Please?

431
00:54:55,727 --> 00:54:57,718
- No.
- I can't sleep.

432
00:55:00,687 --> 00:55:03,281
Come on, Frank. Let her live a little.

433
00:55:04,327 --> 00:55:08,161
- Give her half of one.
- All right. We're on.

434
00:55:18,407 --> 00:55:20,284
Night-night.

435
00:55:21,047 --> 00:55:23,561
You're a big softie, Frank.

436
00:55:52,927 --> 00:55:54,804
Frank?

437
00:55:54,887 --> 00:55:56,878
Hannah?

438
00:55:56,967 --> 00:55:58,764
Frank?

439
00:56:04,167 --> 00:56:06,158
Hello? Hello!

440
00:56:07,167 --> 00:56:08,361
Hello!

441
00:56:08,447 --> 00:56:10,836
Hello! Hello!

442
00:56:18,607 --> 00:56:20,598
Shh...

443
00:56:21,927 --> 00:56:24,600
You're having a bad dream, that's all.

444
00:56:27,247 --> 00:56:29,238
Thanks, Dad.

445
00:57:03,087 --> 00:57:05,555
Come on, sleepyhead.

446
00:57:09,087 --> 00:57:11,078
Come on, Babe Ruth.

447
00:57:14,167 --> 00:57:15,964
Hurry up.

448
00:57:17,647 --> 00:57:21,003
- Did I miss breakfast?
- You'll sleep through anything.

449
00:57:21,087 --> 00:57:25,877
- Did you have a fry-up?
- We'll stop at a pub on the way. Door!

450
00:57:49,447 --> 00:57:53,759
Our location is the
42nd blockade, the M602,

451
00:57:53,847 --> 00:57:56,805
27 miles northeast of Manchester.

452
00:57:56,887 --> 00:57:58,718
You must find us. Please!

453
00:57:58,807 --> 00:58:00,843
Salvation is here.

454
00:58:00,927 --> 00:58:03,839
The answer to Infection is here.

455
00:58:34,567 --> 00:58:36,558
Must be Manchester.

456
00:58:38,687 --> 00:58:41,918
The whole of Manchester, the whole city.

457
00:58:43,687 --> 00:58:45,917
No fire crews to put it out.

458
00:59:38,487 --> 00:59:40,955
42nd blockade.

459
00:59:41,047 --> 00:59:43,277
This is it.

460
01:00:51,527 --> 01:00:55,361
I don't understand, Dad.
Did they leave?

461
01:00:55,447 --> 01:00:58,439
- I don't like this. I think we should go.
- No!

462
01:01:05,007 --> 01:01:09,637
Vehicles. We should check the vehicles.
There has to be something.

463
01:01:27,047 --> 01:01:28,878
Nothing.

464
01:01:28,967 --> 01:01:30,798
I can't believe it.

465
01:01:30,887 --> 01:01:32,764
Frank...

466
01:01:33,207 --> 01:01:35,004
Frank!

467
01:01:37,127 --> 01:01:38,719
- We have to go.
- Yeah.

468
01:01:38,807 --> 01:01:41,196
Go fucking where?!

469
01:02:18,727 --> 01:02:20,797
Get out of it.

470
01:02:24,167 --> 01:02:26,158
Get out of it!

471
01:02:43,247 --> 01:02:45,715
Dad, are you all right?

472
01:02:45,807 --> 01:02:48,367
Yeah, I'm fine, sweetheart.

473
01:02:49,247 --> 01:02:51,841
Sorry I lost my temper.

474
01:02:51,927 --> 01:02:53,963
Hannah...

475
01:02:54,047 --> 01:02:56,880
I love you very much.

476
01:02:56,967 --> 01:02:58,878
- What?
- Keep away from me.

477
01:02:58,967 --> 01:03:01,197
Stay where you are.

478
01:03:01,287 --> 01:03:04,085
- Dad?
- Keep away from me! Keep away from me!

479
01:03:04,167 --> 01:03:06,556
Keep away! Keep away! Keep away!

480
01:03:06,647 --> 01:03:09,639
- Dad!
- Keep away! Keep away!

481
01:03:11,087 --> 01:03:13,726
What's wrong? Dad!

482
01:03:17,847 --> 01:03:20,156
Jim! Jim, he's infected!

483
01:03:20,247 --> 01:03:22,761
- No!
- Now, Jim! Now!

484
01:03:22,847 --> 01:03:26,123
- Jim, kill him! Jim!
- Dad!

485
01:03:26,207 --> 01:03:27,435
Kill him!

486
01:03:35,567 --> 01:03:37,762
Stay away from him!

487
01:03:38,967 --> 01:03:41,276
Keep away from the body!

488
01:03:43,927 --> 01:03:45,724
Dad?

489
01:04:07,207 --> 01:04:09,767
Three survivors. One male, two female.

490
01:04:09,847 --> 01:04:13,044
I repeat, one male, two female.

491
01:04:13,127 --> 01:04:15,595
ETA, 15.

492
01:04:15,687 --> 01:04:18,042
Put the kettle on.

493
01:05:04,047 --> 01:05:06,436
I'm Major Henry West.

494
01:05:07,647 --> 01:05:09,285
- Welcome.
- Jim.

495
01:05:09,367 --> 01:05:11,278
Hello, Jim.

496
01:05:11,367 --> 01:05:13,039
Hello.

497
01:05:15,207 --> 01:05:19,883
Well, we've got beds with clean sheets
and a boiler that produces hot water.

498
01:05:19,967 --> 01:05:22,276
So you can all have a shower.

499
01:05:22,367 --> 01:05:25,564
You look like you need one. Please.

500
01:05:44,687 --> 01:05:49,681
It ain't funny. I got loads of cooking to do,
you fucking Doris!

501
01:05:50,727 --> 01:05:52,763
Run him over!

502
01:05:55,367 --> 01:05:58,040
How is she doing?

503
01:05:58,127 --> 01:06:01,164
She's lost her dad, Jim. That's how she is.

504
01:06:03,727 --> 01:06:06,116
It's all fucked.

505
01:06:06,207 --> 01:06:08,118
What do you mean?

506
01:06:12,967 --> 01:06:16,403
Oh, don't do that.
Come on, come on, come on.

507
01:06:16,487 --> 01:06:18,478
Hey, don't do that.

508
01:06:20,087 --> 01:06:24,877
Hannah is what Frank says she is. Tough,
strong, and she'll cope just like I'll cope.

509
01:06:24,967 --> 01:06:28,721
- Just like you'll cope.
- I don't want her to have to fucking cope.

510
01:06:29,967 --> 01:06:32,276
I want her to be OK.

511
01:06:33,807 --> 01:06:35,877
When Hannah had her dad it was OK.

512
01:06:35,967 --> 01:06:38,640
It was OK for them and it was OK for us.

513
01:06:41,847 --> 01:06:44,156
Now it's all just fucked.

514
01:07:14,327 --> 01:07:17,046
So you heard our broadcast?

515
01:07:17,127 --> 01:07:20,483
- Yeah, we did.
- We must be a disappointment.

516
01:07:20,567 --> 01:07:26,437
You were hoping for a full brigade. An army
base with helicopters and a field hospital.

517
01:07:28,767 --> 01:07:32,760
- We were just hoping for...
- The answer to Infection.

518
01:07:35,007 --> 01:07:36,998
Yeah.

519
01:07:37,087 --> 01:07:41,399
As I said before, it's here. Though
it may not be quite what you imagined.

520
01:07:41,767 --> 01:07:44,565
- Just feel lucky to have found you.
- You were lucky.

521
01:07:44,647 --> 01:07:47,639
The fire drove hundreds of Infected
out of Manchester.

522
01:07:47,727 --> 01:07:50,685
The surrounding area's teeming with them.

523
01:07:52,367 --> 01:07:54,881
But don't worry.

524

Hannah?

778
01:35:42,247 --> 01:35:44,238
Hannah?

779
01:35:44,327 --> 01:35:45,760
Selena?

780
01:35:56,447 --> 01:36:00,645
I haven't got any bullets.
I haven't got any fucking bullets!

781
01:36:04,927 --> 01:36:07,487
Don't fucking leave me!

782
01:36:50,767 --> 01:36:52,439
Come on!

783
01:36:54,327 --> 01:36:56,283
Move!

784
01:36:56,367 --> 01:36:58,881
Move! Move!

785
01:37:01,447 --> 01:37:06,043
It's just you and me now, darlin'.
But don't worry, I'll get you out of here.

786
01:37:06,127 --> 01:37:10,405
Then we'll find a nice little fucking place
somewhere. Just you and me.

787
01:37:10,487 --> 01:37:12,717
And we'll live happy ever after, eh?

788
01:38:14,447 --> 01:38:16,836
That was longer than a heartbeat.

789

Jim?

790
01:38:30,527 --> 01:38:33,917
Listen. Listen. It's not all fucked.

791
01:38:39,447 --> 01:38:41,836
We're gonna be OK. It's not all fucked.

792
01:38:41,927 --> 01:38:45,124
- I've got to explain something.
- Shut up.

793
01:38:45,847 --> 01:38:48,042
It's gonna be OK.

794
01:38:53,287 --> 01:38:56,723
Hannah, it's OK! He's not infected.

795
01:38:56,807 --> 01:38:58,798
But I thought he was biting you.

796
01:38:58,887 --> 01:39:01,447
I was kissing her. Are you stoned?

797
01:39:01,527 --> 01:39:03,597
- It's a long story.

798
01:39:03,687 --> 01:39:05,723
We have to get out of here. Come on!

799
01:39:08,407 --> 01:39:10,398
Come on! Move!

800
01:39:17,127 --> 01:39:19,197
You killed all my boys.

801
01:39:19,287 --> 01:39:20,879
Wait...

802
01:39:27,967 --> 01:39:29,400
Hannah!

803
01:39:29,487 --> 01:39:31,045
Hannah? Hannah!

804
01:39:32,647 --> 01:39:34,763
Hannah!

805
01:39:50,247 --> 01:39:51,760
Get in.

806
01:40:09,967 --> 01:40:11,685
They're locked.

807
01:40:11,767 --> 01:40:14,076
The gates are locked!

808
01:40:16,607 --> 01:40:18,598
Fucking do it!

809
01:40:40,007 --> 01:40:42,316
Come on, Jim, breathe! Fucking breathe!

810
01:41:02,247 --> 01:41:04,442
Not the curtains as well.

811
01:42:12,207 --> 01:42:14,767
You looked all right in this, you know.

812
01:42:15,927 --> 01:42:17,360
It's coming!

813
01:42:33,367 --> 01:42:35,437
- You definitely heard it?
- Yeah!

814
01:42:35,527 --> 01:42:38,724
- I can't hear anything!
- I told you, I heard it!

815
01:42:58,367 --> 01:43:00,119
Go.

816
01:43:31,927 --> 01:43:34,725
Do you think he saw us this time?
